greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of phi(-x) / psi(x^4) in powers of x where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
eta(q^2) * eta(q^8)^6 = eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4)^2 * eta(q^8) * eta(q^16)^2 + 2 * eta(q^2) * eta(q^4)^2 * eta(q^16)^4 is equivalent to the a(4*n), ..., a(4*n + 3) results.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(1/2) * eta(q)^2 * eta(q^4) / (eta(q^2) * eta(q^8)^2) in powers of q.
Given g.f. A(x), then B(q) = A(q)^2 / q satisfies 0 = f(B(q), B(q^2)) where f(u, v) = u * (u + 8) * (v + 4) - v^2.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (32 t)) = 32^(1/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A187154.
a(4*n + 2) = a(4*n + 3) = 0. a(4*n) = A029838(n). a(4*n + 1) =  -2 * A083365(n). Convolution square is A131124. Convolution inverse is A187154.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 2 x^(1/2) EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, x] / EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, x^2], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A, A2, m); if( n<0, 0, A = x + O(x^2); m=1; while( m<=n, m*=2; A = subst(A, x, x^2); A = 4*A + 16*A^2 + (1 + 8*A) * sqrt(A + 4*A^2)); polcoeff( sqrt(x / A), n))}
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^2 * eta(x^4 + A) / (eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^8 + A)^2), n))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Mar 20 2004, Oct 22 2007
